replies.msg:
話說我XP裏面個Ubuntu 14.04 VM係冇裝GUI, 但間中都會想係入面直接睇下download咗落嚟嘅html or jpg or pdf documents, 噉最快就係個file location度開個http server(e.g. python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000), 再係XP度開個browser睇. 但我噉樣太陽春, 所以就整咗個bash script嚟方邊控制個http server.

但因為太過新手, 唔熟Bash嘅syntax, 一路試一路狂出Bash script error - unary operator expected!
真係CLS! 一google之下, 原來Bash個syntax真係唔係一般學開傳統C, Java, Python, JavaScript嘅人頂得順的. 如果你覺得Python個always mind the space syntax好麻煩, 噉你對住Bash應該會即刻想跳樓, 因為佢唔只要mind the space, 仲要mind埋 " ", ' ', ( ), [ ], [[ ]], , $( ), ;一大堆puntuation marks. 最奇怪係點解variable都要用" "嚟括住佢先正常用得到?!

Agree
Not Agree

Windows batch script 好似比較麻, 暫時諗到(in Windows XP):

How to put a program in the background (i.e. similar to "&" in Linux)
=================================================
e.g.
> start /B python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8000

How to kill a program running in the background
===================================
e.g.
> taskkill /im python.exe /f (kill by image name)
> taskkill /pid 1234 /f (kill by process id)

How to display the details of a specific process running in the background
======================================================
e.g.
> tasklist /nh | findstr /i python.exe

How to get the process id of a program running in the background
================================================
e.g.
> tasklist /nh | findstr /i python.exe > myfile.txt
> for /F "tokens=1,2*" %i in (myfile.txt) do @echo %j

How to sleep (same as Bash script)
==========================
e.g.
> sleep 2
